authors.name: J.K. Rowling
authors.bio: British author, best known for the Harry Potter series.

books.name: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban

authors.name: George R.R. Martin
authors.bio: American novelist and short story writer, known for A Song of Ice and Fire.

authors.name: J.R.R. Tolkien
authors.bio: English writer, poet, and philologist, author of The Lord of the Rings.

authors.name: Agatha Christie
authors.bio: English writer known for her detective novels, especially those featuring Hercule Poirot.

authors.name: Stephen King
authors.bio: American author of horror, supernatural fiction, suspense, and fantasy novels.

books.title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
books.description: Harry Potter, a young boy who discovers he is a wizard, begins his magical education at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. Along the way, he uncovers the truth about his parents' death and faces the dark wizard Voldemort for the first time.

books.title: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
books.description: Harry returns to Hogwarts for his second year, where he discovers a hidden chamber within the school that holds a deadly secret. With the help of his friends, he must confront the dangers lurking within.

books.title: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
books.description: In his third year at Hogwarts, Harry learns about Sirius Black, an escaped prisoner who is believed to be after him. As secrets about his past unravel, Harry discovers the truth about his family and his connection to Sirius.

books.title: A Game of Thrones
books.description: The first book in the epic fantasy series 'A Song of Ice and Fire,' where noble families vie for control of the Iron Throne in the Seven Kingdoms. Betrayal, intrigue, and war shape the fate of the realm.

books.title: A Clash of Kings
books.description: The second book in the series sees the Seven Kingdoms plunged into civil war as various factions claim the Iron Throne. Alliances are forged and broken as the struggle for power continues.

books.title: A Storm of Swords
books.description: The third book in the series follows the aftermath of war, with new alliances forming and old ones breaking. The stakes are higher than ever as the battle for the Iron Throne rages on.

books.title: The Fellowship of the Ring
books.description: The first book in 'The Lord of the Rings' trilogy, where Frodo Baggins begins his journey to destroy the One Ring. Alongside a fellowship of companions, he faces the growing threat of Sauron.

books.title: The Two Towers
books.description: The second book in the trilogy follows the fellowship as they are split into different paths. Frodo and Sam continue their journey to Mordor, while others face battles and betrayals.

books.title: The Return of the King
books.description: The final book in the trilogy sees the epic conclusion of the battle against Sauron. Frodo reaches Mount Doom, and Aragorn claims his rightful place as king.

books.title: Murder on the Orient Express
books.description: Detective Hercule Poirot investigates a murder aboard the luxurious Orient Express. With every passenger a suspect, he must unravel the mystery before the killer strikes again.

books.title: And Then There Were None
books.description: Ten strangers are invited to a remote island under mysterious circumstances. As they are killed one by one, they must uncover the identity of the murderer among them before it's too late.

books.title: The Shining
books.description: Jack Torrance becomes the caretaker of the Overlook Hotel, bringing his family along for the winter. As the hotelâ€™s dark secrets come to light, Jack descends into madness, threatening his wife and son.

books.title: It
books.description: A group of childhood friends reunite as adults to confront an ancient, shape-shifting evil that terrorized their hometown years ago. Together, they must face their fears to defeat the creature known as Pennywise.

books.title: Misery
books.description: After a car accident, author Paul Sheldon is rescued by his 'number one fan,' Annie Wilkes. However, her obsession with his work turns dangerous as she forces him to write a new novel under her control.
